quiz.question: What is a floating exchange rate?
options: Rate determined by market supply and demand
Rate set by a government decree
Rate fixed to the price of gold
quiz.answer: Rate determined by market supply and demand

quiz.question: How can fiscal policy affect exchange rates indirectly?
options: By influencing growth and interest expectations that affect capital flows
By directly setting spot market rates
By issuing foreign currency coins
quiz.answer: By influencing growth and interest expectations that affect capital flows

quiz.question: Which term describes the practice of invoicing trade in a dominant foreign currency?
options: Invoicing currency dominance (e.g., invoicing in USD)
Domestic currency billing mandate
Barter trade standardization
quiz.answer: Invoicing currency dominance (e.g., invoicing in USD)

quiz.question: Which market provides continuous trading of currencies worldwide?
options: Foreign exchange (Forex)
Commodity market
Bond market

quiz.question: Which measure compares a currency's value against a basket of other currencies?
options: Trade-weighted exchange rate index
Consumer price index
Nominal GDP

quiz.question: What is the main critique of simple PPP for exchange rate forecasting?
options: It ignores transport costs, nontraded goods, and slow price adjustment
It requires second currency to be gold
It works perfectly at daily frequency
quiz.answer: It ignores transport costs, nontraded goods, and slow price adjustment

quiz.question: What does a stronger domestic currency mean for imports?
options: Imported goods become cheaper
Imported goods become more expensive
No change to import prices

quiz.question: What does purchasing power parity (PPP) predict about exchange rates over time?
options: Currencies will adjust so identical goods cost the same
Interest rates will equalize across countries
Capital controls will be removed
quiz.answer: Currencies will adjust so identical goods cost the same

quiz.question: Which indicator measures real effective exchange rate (REER)?
options: Trade-weighted nominal exchange rate adjusted for relative prices
Spot exchange rate against the dollar only
Central bank policy rate averaging
quiz.answer: Trade-weighted nominal exchange rate adjusted for relative prices

quiz.question: What does 'bid price' mean in FX quotes?
options: Price at which a dealer will buy a currency
Price at which a dealer will sell a currency
Price at which government sets the currency
quiz.answer: Price at which a dealer will buy a currency

quiz.question: What does 'exchange rate overshooting' describe in monetary theory?
options: Exchange rate swings more than long-run value after a shock
Currency never moves after policy change
Gradual convergence without volatility
quiz.answer: Exchange rate swings more than long-run value after a shock

quiz.question: Which empirical regularity shows that real exchange rates are highly persistent?
options: Real exchange rate mean reversion is slow and half-lives are long
Real exchange rates revert instantly to PPP
Real exchange rates never change
quiz.answer: Real exchange rate mean reversion is slow and half-lives are long

quiz.question: Which of these is a commonly traded currency acronym: GBP stands for?
options: British pound
Canadian dollar
Swiss franc

quiz.question: What is 'real exchange rate'?
options: Nominal rate adjusted for price level differences
Nominal rate adjusted for interest rates
Nominal rate fixed by central bank
quiz.answer: Nominal rate adjusted for price level differences

quiz.question: Which advanced tool can central banks use to shape longer-term FX expectations indirectly?
options: Forward guidance and macroprudential measures
Coin minting only
Setting consumer prices directly
